Author: rst
Content:
Switching DNS would not affect the operations of a transparent proxy, which is most likely what we're seeing here. Rather than giving a false IP address for target web sites, that setup ignores the destination IP of all HTTP traffic, diverting it instead through the proxy.

(Hacking DNS in the obvious way would change the apparent IP address of everything, including, say, servers that the user was trying to 'ssh' into --- and 'ssh' would detect and complain. One reason the transparent proxy is more likely.)

Author: pascal_cuoq
Content: The suggestion remembered by tankenmate is for summing numbers of the same sign. If the numbers are not the same sign, ordering them to minimal error is more complicated and people simply use other algorithms, either Kahan's summation or something from http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~demmel/AccurateSummation.pdf"

Author: pilif
Content:
You conveniently left out the second phrase in the same paragraph:

> IMPORTING THIS SOFTWARE INTO OTHER COUNTRIES IS AT YOUR OWN RISK. SOME COUNTRIES PROHIBIT ENCRYPTED COMMUNICATIONS. USING THIS SOFTWARE IN OTHER COUNTRIES MIGHT BE RESTRICTED.

I'm sure that there are some countries out there where running a VPN Server or using a VPN client is illegal. I can't tell you which countries though.

So from their prespective, warning against using it in any country but the one they are sure it's legal using it in is probably a good thing to do.

If you think it's safe to use in your country (it's safe in mine, though I'm happy with my current OpenVPN and l2tp over ipsec setup), go ahead.

Author: quinnchr
Content:
"it seems the physical, hot, dirty (despite having very good potential for making money and establishing a career) jobs are acceptable to be "men only"."

There are plenty of programs designed to encourage women in those fields. You probably don't hear about them because, like me, you tend to read more about technology than construction or plumbing.

http://www.tradeswomen.org/links.php

http://www.nawic.org/nawic/default.asp

"You seem to be adding evidence that implies men are more versatile and adaptable than women."

No
Created: I was adding evidence that women face higher barriers to entry of male dominated fields than men do in entering women dominated fields."

Author: gte910h
Content:
>Full time removal of telomere lengthening means no cancer

It's not that simple. Injecting mammals with serums designed to do this tends to cause tons of tumors actually

>The loss of telomeres with age and the resulting genomic instability coupled with onset of telomerase activity are of critical importance in tumourigenesis and in tumour progression.19 Telomere shortening in somatic cells and the subsequent replicative senescence may prevent uncontrolled cell proliferation and thereby malignant transformation. The tumour suppressor function of telomeres has also been suggested.19,20 However, extensive proliferation and the subsequent telomere shortening/lengthening may also result in telomere dysfunction.

from http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK6524/

Basically
Created:
the fact telomeres shorten may mean many cancers burn themselves out if they divide too fast.

So it may require we solve large tumor killing and organ regen before we can use telomerase"

Author: desireco42
Content:
I am using Bittorrent Sync as of September and I couldn't be happier. It sync well, if I ever need more space, I will just add new harddisk.

Only thing that DropBox does and it doesn't, Ipad apps are supporting DropBox. Still I don't feel that I am missing out much.

One more good thing is that I have a lot of photos, they are close to 1Tb and I don't need to sync every single one. I can pick album I want to have. So it works well.

Not having to think about how much space it takes is biggest advantage for me.

Author: dionyziz
Content: Don't use your ISP's DNS. Switch to another DNS. And use HTTPS for everything, including TLS for e-mail. (Perhaps even consider VPN or SSH tunneling your traffic.)

Author: quinnchr
Content:
That was my point, it's a scholarship based on physiology. There's hundreds of scholarships like this, why is that necessarily a problem?

The are scholarships for men in nursing, there are scholarships for little people, there are scholarships for those on the autism spectrum, there are scholarships for the left handed, etc...

Why is this problematic? Is it inherently wrong for tall people to encourage other tall people to attain a higher education?
